content: this is dmg and we're talking about how to make a water filling room
more water filling rooms and passages okay so we're going to grab a
polypropylene sheet I got this from Daiso which is a basically a Japanese
dollar store that we have in Australia and it's a clear color so it's blue and
it's transparent you can see through it it's got texture on one side and it's
smooth on the other now normally I don't want to go and buy a things like this
but I you know you could use something like cellophane but we'll see you later
on why I've chosen to use this it's not very expensive and you get to a lot of
mileage out of this 400 by 750 ish sheet now this is 70 point seven five
millimeters thick so it's quite thick plastic and you probably have to cut
through a few times with the blade to actually cut it you could use pierces if
you want there's just a little bit quicker and I use a ruler just to get
that straight edge to it so again just go a couple of times and then you just
place it in the tile and see it's a little bit too big so all you're gonna
do then is just grab pair of scissors make sure you just slice off an extra
millimeter and it should fit snugly and you don't want to just be too loose it
fitting snugly it's good because they won't fall out as easily so now I got
the stairs descending I don't really want the stairs go beyond the first two
or three steps so what I'm gonna do I'm just gonna trace the outline of that
stair and with a marker and this is so that those stairs will be exposed and
complete the faux 3d effect so I'm just gonna cut those out with a pair of
scissors and you can keep those little off cut pieces now you probably use them
later for something else if you just want to do some puddles or something you
can shape those and there you go slots in quite nicely and you could great for
a 3d steer effect now I do grab a peak baking paper the parchment paper in the
US and then I'm going to create ripples with the hot glue gun
and this is why use the polypropylene for the trouble closing she'd rather
than the cellophane because the Scylla fain if you apply the hot glue to it are
just going to bunch up and and and towards the hot glue and there you go
with the ripples on the polypropylene sheet and it looks very very cool so now
I'm just gonna do a passageway so grab the same sheet and just mark and cut out
the passageway make sure that it fits which is fine and then apply the hot
glue as before and away you go you can effectively do a whole bunch of modular
bits and pieces like this and it's very easy and useful just plunk down
you are now underwater very easy so that's how you make a water filling room
